title: Living Room Organization
description: The living room is the heart of the home. Keeping it organized, clean, and functional makes it a welcoming space for both relaxation and entertaining guests.
sentences: Declutter surfaces daily; a 10-minute tidy-up can make a huge difference.
Use functional furniture with hidden storage to conceal clutter.
Arrange furniture to create conversational zones and clear pathways.
Implement a 'one in, one out' rule for decorative items, books, and magazines.
Manage cables and cords to create a cleaner, safer environment.
dos: Assign a specific home for every item (e.g., remote controls, keys).
Use trays and decorative boxes to group small items together.
Clean dust and vacuum/mop at least once a week.
Choose lighting that is both functional and creates a warm ambiance.
donts: Don't let mail and papers pile up on tables.
Don't push all furniture against the walls; create space.
Don't over-clutter with too many decorative objects.
Don't ignore stains on upholstery; treat them as soon as possible.
